pullRequest.body:
---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

</details>

</details>

---

#### Declarations diff

`+ compCoyonedaIso`
`+ compYonedaIso`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.
Is this version preferable or should I maybe add a more universe-general version which uses a lift functor?
Also, this should maybe use `restrictedYoneda`, but that only comes much later in the import graph...

I think it's fine to add this version, maybe with a TODO about generalising universes in case someone else needs it. 
There should be lemmas describing this iso, hopefully `simps` gives you them? 
About `restrictedYoneda` - it seems reasonable to have both (with the restricted version in a different file + PR). I also edited your PR title to fit the commit conventions!
The "restricted Version" would be the same, `restrictedYoneda` is just short for the right hand side of the iso.

> The "restricted Version" would be the same, `restrictedYoneda` is just short for the right hand side of the iso.

Ah! Perhaps a more sensible thing to do might be to make this iso there, and add a comment in the module docstring pointing to it? Alternatively `restrictedYoneda` seems like a simple enough definition that it could be moved?

:v: javra can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).
I think I'll just move `restrictedYoneda` in a separate PR, I think there's also a few convenience lemmas about `restrictedYoneda` missing.
bors r+

(Aware of the increase in imports, I just don't know if these lemmas deserve their own file in order to prevent this, also I do have some other lemmas locally that might move `CategoryTheory.Yoneda` further up the graph...)

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11140652465/job/30959886252)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11140652465/job/30959886623)
bors d+
bors d+

```suggestion
def compYonedaIso {C : Type u₁} [Category.{v₁} C] {D : Type u₂} [Category.{v₁} D]
```
seems a bit more helpful imo, since comp appears on the left. Or, we could swap the iso around and talk about `yonedaCompIso`?
I like the current direction more because it has the non-whiskered functor on the left-hand side, I'll just rename it

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(CategoryTheory/Adjunction): composing a right adjoint with yoneda
